thread.title: S.F. commercial buildings becoming more efficient
thread.title_full: S.F. commercial buildings becoming more efficient - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Jenna Lyons
title: S.F. commercial buildings becoming more efficient
text:
Photo: John King, The Chronicle The iconic Flood Building at Powell and Market streets is among 176 commercial buildings in San Francisco that have dramatically reduced energy use in the last five years, according to a report. The iconic Flood Building at Powell and Market streets is among 176...
The energy use of San Francisco’s commercial buildings has dramatically dropped over the past five years, potentially saving millions of dollars annually and reducing greenhouse gases in the atmosphere, according to a performance report released Monday. The iconic Flood Building at Powell and Market streets is among 176 commercial buildings in San Francisco that have dramatically reduced energy use in the last five years, according to a report. The energy use of San Francisco’s commercial buildings has dramatically dropped over the past five years, potentially saving millions of dollars annually and reducing greenhouse gases in the atmosphere, according to a performance report released Monday.
